title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
મોટા ભક્ત મારુ દેશના, અને મોટાં જેનાં મન<RHYME_206577>; 
સંગ કુસંગને ઓળખી, વળી થયા હરિના જન<RHYME_206577>.
gujarati.context: The great devotee's heart is their country and the greatness of God; understanding the song of separation and attachment, they have taken shelter in God's love.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
લેશ નહિ જે દેશમાં, સમજવા સુધી રીત્ય; 
એવા દેશમાં ઊપજી, જેણે કરી હરિશું પ્રીત.
gujarati.context: In a land where there is no oppression, one can understand the true path; In such a land, love blooms forth from one who has done good deeds with devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એવા જન પાવનનાં, કહું કાંયેક હવે નામ<RHYME_206578>; 
ઉચ્ચ નીચ કુળમાં અવતરી, જેણે ભજ્યા સુંદરશ્યામ<RHYME_206578>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

I praise those who have a noble descent, regardless of name; whoever has been born in a high or low family has been blessed by beautiful Lord Shyam.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ખરા ભક્ત કહીએ ખાણ્ય ગામે, દેવજાતિ શંભુદાસ નામે; 
ઘેર લાલુબાઈ હરિજન<RHYME_206577>, જેણે જન્મ્યા લાડુજી પાવન<RHYME_206580>.
gujarati.context: A true devotee says Shambhudasa is the name of God, and in this village, Harijan is the one who was born as a sweet (Laddu).
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
રૂડા ભક્ત છે ખીમોજીભાઈ<RHYME_206581>, ઘેરે મોટાં જન મોજબાઈ<RHYME_206581>; 
એહાદિ બીજાં જન ગણીજે, ભલા ભક્ત ખાણમાં ભણીજે.
gujarati.context: The humble devotee is filled with joy and respect, surrounded by great people in awe; the true devotee's heart is fed by the Lord, not the words of others.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત એક છે ચેલો લુવાર<RHYME_206583>, વસે તે ભીલમાલ મોઝાર<RHYME_206583>; 
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત હેમરાજ નામે, ભજે હરિ રહે નરોલી ગામે.
gujarati.context: The devout is one with the Lord's love, having surrendered completely; their mind and heart are in harmony. A warrior devotee named Hemraj worships Hari in Nrooli village.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત કણબી દેવશી જાણિયે, દ્વિજ ચેલો ગામ ઝુઝાંણિયે; 
વાલિ ગામે વસે બહુ જન<RHYME_206577>, દ્વિજ વિરમ ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206577>.
gujarati.context: A devotee's true wealth is knowing God; a pious person's abode is in heaven.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ વખતો ગામ જોધાવે, વ્યાધ મેઘરાજ ભક્ત કાવે; 
ભક્ત વખતો જાત્યે વાઘરી, રહી ઊનડિયે ભજ્યા હરિ.
gujarati.context: In times of sorrow, the soul finds solace in devotion; when circumstances are favorable, one should worship God with all their heart and soul.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ખીમો ભજે હરિ ભાવ ભલે, જાત્યે વાઘરી વસે સાયલે; 
હરિભક્ત વાઘરી ઈશરો, વસે દાસપામાં દાસ ખરો.
gujarati.context: The devotee worships the Lord with utmost devotion and sincerity, even if it's a humble position like being a slave. In return, the Lord bestows His grace, elevating the devotee to a higher state.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ગામ ભુકા માંહિ ભજે હરિ, ભક્ત અમરો જાત્યે વાઘરી; 
ભક્ત જોધો જન જીવીબાઈ, રહે વાઘરી ગામ દેતા માંઇ.
gujarati.context: The devotee worships God in their village and remains alive, while the one who is not devoted dies in the village itself.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત વાલો વખાણું વાઘરી, ભલી ભક્તિ પ્રભુજીની કરી; 
બાઈ રૂપા મેઘી ને કેશર<RHYME_206589>, ગામ સુરાણે ભક્ત સુંદર<RHYME_206589>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's love is consumed by God, and pure devotion brings them closer to the Lord. The beauty of the soul shines like a cloudless sky, with the entire village praising the devotee's loveliness.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ઉદો વાઘરી રહે ગામ ધાખે, મુખે સ્વામિનારાયણ ભાખે; 
ભક્ત જીવો વાઘરી વાલેરે, ભજે ભગવાન રૂડી પેર્યે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a devotee who remains steadfast in their faith like a lion in the forest, and with devotion they attain spiritual liberation. The devotee's love for God is unshakeable, just like a lion's roar echoes through the land.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત વાઘરી પદમો નામ<RHYME_206578>, ભજે હરિ રહે આકવે ગામ<RHYME_206578>; 
ગામ ચોરવે જીવો વાઘરી, તજી કુળધર્મ ભજ્યા હરિ.
gujarati.context: A devotee's true wealth lies not in material possessions but in the Lord; only when one's faith is pure can they truly worship Him.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ વાઘરી અપાર<RHYME_206583>, વસે તે મારુદેશ મોઝાર<RHYME_206583>; 
તજી મેલી નિજ કુળ રીતિ, કરી પ્રકટ પ્રભુ સાથે પ્રીતિ.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet conveys a sense of gratitude for one's homeland and culture, expressing love and devotion to their native land and traditions. It emphasizes the importance of preserving one's identity and being proud of one's cultural heritage.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સારા ભક્ત છે શિરોઈ ગામ<RHYME_206578>, કહું સાંભળજ્યો તેનાં નામ<RHYME_206578>; 
મોટા ભક્ત છે જાત્યે લુવાર<RHYME_206583>, કરું તેનાં નામનો ઉચાર<RHYME_206583>.
gujarati.context: The devout is a guiding light in the village, and I will recall their name. A great devotee is one who humbles themselves at the divine's feet, and I will utter the name of the Lord.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દલો રતનો લખમણ લહીએ<RHYME_206592>, પનો મેરામ અજબો કહીએ<RHYME_206592>; 
જેઠો હદે ધન રૂપ ધીરો, મૂળો પદમો હવો ને વીરો.
gujarati.context: A person's true worth is revealed when they face difficulties and hardships, not just in prosperity. A brave warrior's strength lies not in their physical form, but in their unwavering courage and character.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હદા પના આદિ બહુ ભાઈ<RHYME_206594>, હવે કહું હરિજન બાઈ<RHYME_206594>; 
દલુ વાલુ ઉમાબાઈ સોનાં, લાધી મટુ ઇન્દુબાઈ પુના.
gujarati.context: A brother-in-law says that his wife has become a Harijan (outcaste) and is now known as Uma Bai; similarly, another's wife has been labeled Indubai Punja.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહાદિ બાઈ ભાઈ લુવાર<RHYME_206583>, એક ભક્ત છે શવો કુંભાર<RHYME_206583>; 
એહ આદિ બીજાં જન સોઇ, ભજે હરિ રહે ગામ શિરોઈ.
gujarati.context: A devotee is like a dead man, and the world is like a coffin. He should worship God, remain in His remembrance, and let go of worldly attachments.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત છે પ્રેમો કુલાલ<RHYME_206595>, સત્સંગી એ ગામ જવાલ<RHYME_206595>; 
રૂડો રબારી નામ છે કલો, ગામ ગોયલિમાં ભક્ત ભલો.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee is pure and full of love, residing in a community that reverberates with devotion. The name "Kalo" is synonymous with true devotion, where God's devotees flourish like blooming flowers.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એક ભક્ત પવિત્ર પાળીયે, તુલાધાર ઉધાર તે કહિયે; 
નામ હરિજન હેમરાજ<RHYME_206598>, હરિ ભજી કર્યું નિજ કાજ<RHYME_206598>.
gujarati.context: A devotee worships with pure devotion, and God grants him his true desires; the devotee's name is Hemraj, who worships God and fulfills his own destiny.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ મારુદેશ માંઇ, બીજાં બહુ ભક્ત બાઈ ભાઈ<RHYME_206594>; 
સરવે સોંપી તન મન ધન<RHYME_206599>, કરે સ્વામીશ્રીજીનું ભજન<RHYME_206599>.
gujarati.context: This couplet describes one's own land as the best, where many devotees reside; and it is a place of worship where one can dedicate their mind, wealth, and soul to God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હવે કહું ગુજરાતી જન<RHYME_206577>, અતિ પવિત્ર ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206577>; 
હેત પ્રીત્યે ભર્યાં જેનાં હૈયાં, પ્રેમી નેમીમાં ન જાય કહિયાં.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

I am speaking to the people of Gujarat, who are sacred devotees; those whose hearts are filled with love cannot leave it even if they wish to.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એવા જનનાં લખતાં નામ<RHYME_206578>, મારા હૈયા માંહિ ઘણી હામ<RHYME_206578>; 
સોની ભક્ત છે કસ્તુરોભાઈ<RHYME_206594>, હરિજન દ્વિજ શિવબાઈ<RHYME_206601>.
gujarati.context: A person's good deeds are inscribed in their name, and many virtues reside within me; Soni is devoted to Kasturba, Harijan Dwij is Shivbhai.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૦: મારુદેશ તથા ગુજરદેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 120: Māru Desh tathā Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સાચી ભક્તિ એ સ્વામીની કરે, ભજે હરિ રહે આમનગરે; 
જન જતન બાઈ દયાળ<RHYME_206603>, દ્વિજ ભક્ત રહે પેઢમાળ<RHYME_206603>.
gujarati.context: True devotion is done by the Lord's will, and one who worships Hari resides in Amangar. Only a select few devotees remain pure and reside in Peethamal.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā jannā lakhatā nām, mārā haiyā māhi ghaṇī hām; <RHYME_23>
Sonī bhakta chhe Kasturobhāī, harijan dvij Shivabāī.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks about the impermanence of life (jannā lakhatā nām) and how even a lowly person like a fisherman can be devoted to God (Sonī bhakta chhe).

transliteration.couplet:
Sāchī bhakti e Swāmīnī kare, bhaje Hari rahe Āmanagare; <RHYME_24>
Jan Jatan bāī dayāḷ, dvij bhakta rahe Peḍhamāḷ.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: True devotion is done by the Lord's mercy, and one remains in love with God in their own village; A compassionate soul resides in a pure heart, a devotee of the three worlds.

transliteration.couplet:
Haribhakta dvij Ichchhābāī, vase gām te Pogalā māi; <RHYME_25>
Dvij bhakta Jīvī harijan, gām Pilodare e pāvan.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: A devotee's desire is to attain God's love, and their soul becomes pure like the Ganges River. A true devotee's life is filled with spiritual purity and devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Ukobhāī kahīe, te rahe gām Mānmaroliye; <RHYME_26>
Premī bhakta rahe Prānti gām, dvij Mayārām Kāshīrām.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two types of devotees: one who stays in their hometown and another who travels to sacred places like Kashi.

transliteration.couplet:
Kevaḷrām Nārāyaṇ traṇ, Shīvo Joito Swāmīne sharaṇ; <RHYME_27>
Haribhāī ne Govindrām, Motīrām Jīvarām nām.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: Taking shelter in the Lord's feet is the ultimate refuge. I take the name of Govind and Jiwar for my salvation.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi bhakta dvij pāvan, have kahu bāiyo harijan; <RHYME_28>
Bāī Rūpā ne be Ichchhabāī, vālu traṇyene Harishu sagāī.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The devotee is elevated to the status of a twice-born one, and they are considered Harijan (children of God). The wish-less Rupa has surrendered to Lord Krishna's will, merging with Him in divine love.

transliteration.couplet:
Bāī Rāmu Rakhu ne Māṇyak, sonā nānī Hīru Monghī ek; <RHYME_29>
Fūlabāī Mūḷībāī doy, vakhat ek harijan soy.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context:
A rich man's daughter, Sonali, marries a lowly Harijan boy, and they live together harmoniously.

Their neighbors, who were initially shocked by their mixed status marriage, now praise them for their unity.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek kahīe dvij harijan, have kahu vaṇik pāvan; <RHYME_30>
Moṭo bhakta chhe Tulajārām, Nāthushāne Sānkaḷchand nām.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: A humble devotee of Lord Tulaja Ram is like a pure soul, and one who takes the name of Sanak Chand is considered holy.

transliteration.couplet:
Pītāmbar Bechar Bhagwān, Mīṭhālāl ne Harijīvan; <RHYME_31>
Bāī ben kunvar Ambā ek, ehādi harijan vaṇik.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Lord Krishna, being a blue-skinned God, granted life to Harijivan; one Amba was a merchant's wife who became a devotee of Lord Krishna.

transliteration.couplet:
Sonī Trikamjī harijan, Bhāṭ Aparu Bafato pāvan; <RHYME_32>
Vītarāgī chhe Amṛutbāī, ehādi jan Prānti māhi.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a person who is free from worldly attachments and has reached the state of spiritual bliss, where they are not bound by the cycles of birth and death. This individual's soul is pure and at peace, untouched by worldly desires and emotions.

transliteration.couplet:
Koḷī bhakta rahe Līoḍ gām, Umojī vaḷī Vāghajī nām; <RHYME_33>
Haribhakta chhe Zaverbhāī, jenī prīt chhe Prabhujī māi.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee remains in Vaghai, worshipping God; he is filled with love for God.

A humble devotee like Zaverbhai is always devoted to God, and his heart is full of love for His Majesty.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī Khushāl Bechar nām, bāī aval rahe Sāṇode gām; <RHYME_34>
Koḷī bhakta Dayāḷajī Dhanojī, Chhalojī Sārajī ne Panojī.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The couplet mentions two individuals: Kaṇabī Khushāl Bechar and Aval Rahe from Sañode village, as well as Koḷī bhakta Dayāḷajī Dhanojī, Chhalojī Sārajī, and Panojī.

transliteration.couplet:
Banojī bāī aval fūl, gām Salakiye bhakta amūl; <RHYME_35>
Kaṇabī bhakta Gaṇeshjī kahīe, Bhūdhar Viṭhṭhal Nānajī lahīe.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: In the town of Salakiya, there's a devotee named Banoji who loves flowers, and in Ganeshpur, another devotee named Vitthal Nanaji is known for his devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Trikam ne shā Valabharām, bhakta vakhatbā vaṇik nām; <RHYME_36>
Jan Rūpā Rāmu raḷiyāt, sonī Jamanā vakhat dvij jāt.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna's devotees are known as Vaishnavs, just like a merchant is recognized by their trade. Similarly, people are identified by their social class or caste.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek chhe Rūpāī Nāi jan, ehādi harijan pāvan; <RHYME_37>
Ek luvār Thāvar nāme, eh ādi haribhakta Degāme.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: One is Rupai Naik, a devotee of God, and another is Thavar Naik, a devotee of the Lord Shiva. Both are worshipers of their respective deities in their own homes.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta chhe Manachhārām, Hari mangaḷ Mūḷajī nām; <RHYME_38>
Pītāmbar ādi bhakta bhāī, Jekuvarya jatan Rāmabāī.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context:
The devotee is a noble soul, carrying the name of God Hari; like brothers, saints from all walks of life unite in devotion to Ram.

Pious people from diverse backgrounds gather together, united in their love for Lord Rama.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi bāī bhāī jeh, vase gām Vāsaṇāmā teh; <RHYME_39>
Moṭā bhakta vase chhe Velāl, jan Jesangbhāī dayāḷ.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: A brother lives in Vasna, a place of divine love, and has immense devotion like the all-loving Lord Jesus.

transliteration.couplet:
Jeṭho Jījī Makobhāī kahīe, Aju Vasato Manohar lahīe; <RHYME_40>
Shāmal Giradhar ne Nathubhāī, bāī vakhat raḷiyāt bāī.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The couplet compares two people: one is like a wild bull (Jeṭho Jījī) while the other is like a gentle devotee (Aju Vasato Manohar).

transliteration.couplet:
Jitabā Tejabā Dattabāī, bhakta e kaṇabī kuḷ māi; <RHYME_41>
Dvij Hari ne Avalbāī, eh ādi chhe Velāl māi.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: A devotee's true love is the Lord's, and He in turn loves the devotee's heart; just as a parent loves their child with great affection. Similarly, God loves the soul of every individual with unconditional love.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta Amarasinha nām, Shā Jechand te Kunjāḍya gām; <RHYME_42>
Kaṇabī bhakta kahīe Surdās, bhakta Nāthe tajī jag-āsh.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: Amarasinha was a devotee of the Kṣhatrī clan who lived in Kunjāḍya village, and his devotion was equal to that of Surdās, another great devotee. His devotion was so pure that it reached God's feet and transcended worldly attachments.

transliteration.couplet:
Dayāḷajī ne dās Zaver, kṣhatrī Umobhāī ne Hamīr; <RHYME_43>
Eh ādi bījā bahu jan, rahe Kaṇabhe bhakta pāvan.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context:
Daya's kindness is like a lord's generosity, while Umabhai's benevolence is akin to Hamir's.
This couplet compares the good deeds of various individuals, indicating that some people are blessed with many followers and admirers.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Amadāvāde anek, bhaje Hari taje nahi ṭek; <RHYME_44>
Jiyā virāje Badaripati, tiyā sarave jan shubhmati.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: Many devotees are found in Amadāva, but none have won Hari's favor; only after leaving worldly attachments does one achieve true auspiciousness.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta ādi sheṭh Ichchhārām, Hīrāchand be bhakta akām; <RHYME_45>
Manohar Kuber Govind, Gopāl Gokul ne Ānand.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: A devotee's true intention is to surrender, while a seeker's goal is self-realization. The divine trio of Manohar, Kuber, and Govind brings joy in Gokul.

transliteration.couplet:
Raṇachhoḍ Trikam Bechar, Āshārām Shāmaḷ Kuber; <RHYME_46>
Mohanlāl Dolā ādi bhāī, have kahu harijan bāī.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: A wealthy merchant named Trikam Bechar is compared to a peaceful hermit like Shama Kuber, while another rich man named Mohanlal is just a mere brother of the same name.

transliteration.couplet:
Vrajkuvarya Ratanbāī, āditane harishu sagāī; <RHYME_47>
Ambā Lakṣhamī ne Ṭhakarāṇī, Shāmkuvarya acharat jāṇī.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises Ratanbāī, a gem of Vrajkuvarya, and says that Lakṣhamī has decorated the Thakarāṇī with her beautiful works.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi je vaṇik-vṛund, ek bhakta chhe Haragovind; <RHYME_48>
Have kahu dvij harijan, Nathu jugal jan pāvan.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: There is a merchant who worships only Lord Haragovind, and has no other devotion. He has also been blessed with a son and daughter-in-law.

transliteration.couplet:
Hīmmatrām ne Jīvaṇrām, Hareshvar ne Mahādev nām; <RHYME_49>
Kāshīrām Kuberajī kahīe, Gaṇapatrām nāme doy lahīe.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The divine is present in every being (Hīmmatrām) and has many names like Jīvaṇrām or Mahādev; while Kuberajī is specific to the sacred city of Kashi, Gaṇapatrām is revered for its benevolent qualities.

transliteration.couplet:
Ādit Giradhar Somnāth, kahu harijan bāī sāth; <RHYME_50>
Gangā Revā ne Shivakuvarya, Jamanā Hari dev vipar.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: The couplet refers to the connection between Lord Krishna (Ādit Giradhar Somnath) and his devotees, including low-caste individuals (kahu harijan bāī sāth). It also mentions the divine love of Ganga River (Gangā Revā) for Shiva's fame (Shivakuvarya), as well as the devotion of Jamana to Lord Hari.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta chhe Kubersingh, kahu kaṇabī bhakta anagh; <RHYME_51>
Shambhudās Dāmodar nām, vālo Vajerām Gangārām.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: A devotee of Kubernsingh is a true warrior, while one who worships with pure intentions is sinless. The name Shambhudas Dāmodar is like the rivers Ganga and Vajerām.

transliteration.couplet:
Lāldās do Kevaḷrām, Raṇachhoḍ Dayāḷajī nām; <RHYME_52>
Bhakta Bhāvsinghajī sudhīr, Pītāmbar Pānāchand vīr.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises two saints: Dayāḷajī and Pānāchand, who are known for their self-control (Bhakta) and bravery (vīr).

transliteration.couplet:
Premajī Khushāl Bhāīchand, Hīro Rāyajī Haragovind; <RHYME_53>
Lakho Kasalo ne Gangārām, bhakta vasato Māṇyako nām.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: This couplet describes the devotion of two men, Premajī and Haragovind, who are devotees of Lord Krishna in the city of Mathura, also known as Gokul or Vrindavan.

transliteration.couplet:
Haribhakta bāī Vajī Hari, moṭā jan chhe Mānkuvarī; <RHYME_54>
Ehādi bhakta kaṇabī kahīe, sārā harijan sonī lahīe.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context: The devotee worships Lord Hari and is reborn as Mānkuvarī, a great soul. The devotee's faith is so strong that it shines like a beacon of light in the darkness.

transliteration.couplet:
Puruṣhottam bhakta mangal, Lakṣhamīchand chhe jan amal; <RHYME_55>
Hīrāchand ādi bhakta bhāī, bāī dev ne Divāḷībāī.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: A devotee of Purushottam is blessed with good fortune, and their intentions are pure. Such a devotee is considered a brother by God, just like the one who performs the ritual of Divāḷībāī.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaḍiyā Kuber ne Ambārām, bhaje Hari jāṇī sukhdhām; <RHYME_56>
Bhakta sutār chhe Dāmodar, harijan Jago ne Bhūdhar.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context: Lord Kuber's daughter Amba and Lord Hari are in blissful heaven. The devotee is fortunate to have Dāmodar as his son and Bhūdhar as his spiritual guide.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṛuṣhṇa Bechar ne Ambārām, Hari ādi Jaṇashāli nām; <RHYME_57>
Ehādi bāī bhāī apār, vase Amadāvād mozār.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: A devotee like Kṛuṣhṇa Bechar worships Lord Ambārām, who is known as Hari and others; The one who has a pure soul like mine is not found anywhere else.

transliteration.couplet:
Seve Narnārāyaṇ Dev, pāḍī antare alauki ṭev; <RHYME_58>
Evā jan niramaḷ jeh, nāve lakhatā lakhavāmā teh.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: The devotee of Lord Narayan is one who has realized their own self within and without. One who has understood the true nature of the self can understand the world as well.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanya dhanya evā janne, jenā Hari parāyaṇ man; <RHYME_59>
Tan dhan traṇatole gaṇī, kare Swāmīshrījīnu bhajan.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context: One who has obtained the divine knowledge of Hari's devotion is truly blessed. He sings God's praise with a joyful heart, his soul immersed in bliss.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek ekathī adhik ange, prem niyame pūraṇ; <RHYME_60>
Apār nar-nārī maḷī, vaḷī thayā Swāmīne sharaṇ.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context:
Each moment is precious to fill with love; 
Seek refuge in the Lord, like a boat seeking shelter from the storm.

transliteration.couplet:
Prakaṭ pratāp prāpati, nahi amṛutpadnī udhārya; <RHYME_61>
Evu jāṇī antare, bhaje nirbhaya thaī nar-nārya.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context: Victory is achieved through bravery and confidence, not by seeking eternal life or wealth. One should know their inner self and fearlessly pursue the path of devotion with courage.
